title: depends_on with default variant: differing dependency list from spack spec
body:
Might be a duplicate, I didn't know what to search.

```
$ spack install py-numpy ^openblas@0.2.20
==> Error: py-numpy does not depend on openblas
```
```
$ spack spec py-numpy
Input spec
--------------------------------
py-numpy

Concretized
--------------------------------
py-numpy@1.14.2%gcc@4.9.3+blas+lapack arch=linux-rhel7-ppc64le
--> ^openblas@0.2.20%gcc@4.9.3 cpu_target=POWER8 ~ilp64 patches=47cfa7a952ac7b2e4632c73ae199d69fb54490627b66a62c681e21019c4ddc9d +pic+shared threads=none ~virtual_machine arch=linux-rhel7-ppc64le <--
    ^py-setuptools@39.0.1%gcc@4.9.3 arch=linux-rhel7-ppc64le
        ^python@2.7.14%gcc@4.9.3+dbm~optimizations patches=123082ab3483ded78e86d7c809e98a804b3465b4683c96bd79a2fd799f572244 +pic+pythoncmd+shared~tk~ucs4 arch=linux-rhel7-ppc64le
            ^bzip2@1.0.6%gcc@4.9.3+shared arch=linux-rhel7-ppc64le
            ^gdbm@1.14.1%gcc@4.9.3 arch=linux-rhel7-ppc64le
                ^readline@7.0%gcc@4.9.3 arch=linux-rhel7-ppc64le
                    ^ncurses@6.0%gcc@4.9.3 patches=f84b2708a42777aadcc7f502a261afe10ca5646a51c1ef8b5e60d2070d926b57 ~symlinks~termlib arch=linux-rhel7-ppc64le
                        ^pkgconf@1.4.0%gcc@4.9.3 arch=linux-rhel7-ppc64le
            ^openssl@1.0.2n%gcc@4.9.3+systemcerts arch=linux-rhel7-ppc64le
                ^zlib@1.2.11%gcc@4.9.3+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-rhel7-ppc64le
            ^sqlite@3.22.0%gcc@4.9.3 arch=linux-rhel7-ppc64le
```
```
$ spack install py-numpy
==> Installing openblas
[...]
```
however
```
$ spack install py-numpy+blas ^openblas@0.2.20
```
works.

Are default variants not expanded correctly somewhere in the installation dependency collection process?

---

(I had to specify the full hash to pull in the openblas I already had built, but I think this is a different issue)
